p: Apigenin is the most active flavone which can be found in dietary sources such as chamomile tea, parsley, celery, oranges, celeriac, or wheat [ 72]. It possesses various biological activities such as antiproliferative, anti-angiogenic, anti-oxidative, and anti-inflammatory properties. Adding apigenin to endometriotic stromal cells obtained after surgery, Suou et al. [ 73] observed that it attenuated the protein expression and TNF-α-induced IL-8 gene expression. Two years later, same authors showed that apigenin can suppress cellular proliferation induced by TNF-α. It attenuated chronic inflammation and mitogenic activity by suppressing PGE2 expression and by downregulating the NFkB pathway [ 74].
